# Definitions
[italic]These definitions are used throughout the rest of Marine Law.[/italic]
[color=#00CBFE][bold]Commanding Officer[/bold][/color]: A whitelisted UNMC Commanding Officer. - Anything with the words [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commanding Officer[/bold][/color] only applies to Whitelisted Commanding Officers. These rights cannot be transferred.
\n
[color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]: The current [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] of an operation. Transferable to a new [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color], per the Chain of Command. If the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] is rendered incapable of command [bold]temporarily[/bold], the [color=#90EE90][bold]Duty Officer[/bold][/color] inherits [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] rights. This includes but is not limited to:
- Prolonged communications outage. - The [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] deploying in the field.
If the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] is rendered [bold]permanently[/bold] incapable of command, the next in the Chain of Command becomes the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color], rather than a [color=#90EE90][bold]Duty Officer[/bold][/color]. This includes but is not limited to: - The [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] is relieved of duty due to [bold]arrest[/bold] or [bold]mutiny[/bold]. - The [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] becoming [bold]unrevivable[/bold].
\n
[color=#90EE90][bold]Duty Officer[/bold][/color]: The ranking officer in the Chain of Command who, in the absence of the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color], is placed in command of the warship. - Unless explicitly stated otherwise, the [color=#90EE90][bold]Duty Officer[/bold][/color] is interchangeable with, and inherits the rights of [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] in this case.
\n
[color=#8B0000][bold]Chief MP[/bold][/color]: The Chief of Military Police, assigned to the warship. - Only transferable to a [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] by the [color=#00CBFE][bold]Commanding Officer[/bold][/color], or through vote of the current [color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color] present on the warship.
\n
[color=#ff000d][bold]MP[/bold][/color]: Military Police, including XO's or SO's deputized by the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] who deal with Marine Law.
\n
FOB: The Forward Operating Base. - Designated by the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]. It is a reinforced area, usually being the primary landing zone. - FOBs do not have to be placed adjacent to an extraction point. However, the primary landing zone itself must at least be properly defended and guarded.
\n
Secure Areas - Must be designated by the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color]. It is a reinforced area, where there has been no recent combat or threats. - The FOB is usually a secure area until it is attacked, for example. - The [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] or staff officers may at any point may designate an area no longer secure.
\n
Field Hospital - Must be designated by the [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] or [bold]Chief Medical Officer[/bold]. It is a reinforced area, where there has been no recent combat or threats. - It is the only area aside from the FOB that the [bold]Chief Medical Officer[/bold] or [color=#008000][bold]Commander[/bold][/color] may give permission to doctors and nurse to move to. - It must be considered a [bold]Secure Area[/bold]
\n
[color=#ffa500][bold]Provost Marshal Office[/bold][/color]: Hold significant weight on how Marine Law is handled in their operational areas. - In the event that Marine Law is being mishandled aboard a UNMC warship or within the AO of a UNMC warship, UNMC High Command may see fit to dispatch personnel from Provost. - Members of the [color=#ffa500][bold]Provost Marshal Office[/bold][/color] obey only their direct superiors and are not beholden to the Marine Chain of Command. - Provost [bold]Marshals[/bold] are not required to follow Marine Law. - Provost [bold]Inspectors[/bold] and above are the final word on Marine Law in their AO. - Provost [bold]Advisors[/bold] do not hold any direct authority themselves, however they are expected to ensure Marine Law is correctly handled.
